column4: hey. i'm trying to maintain a repository for lucid and for other versions (natty, oneiric). I have now build my deb for the 3, but problem is if i put them all with reprepro, the deb name conflicts. what's does experience dictate? will it overwrite the old ones? (i.e. the blah.deb for lucid with the blah.deb for oneiric)
putting a 11.10 deb overwrite a 10.10 deb should not be done
what is the proper way for mixing versions?
you should never mix versions like that
what do you mean?
you are not meant to mix versions, it makes your system unusable/unstable
i want to avoid this, but most guides refer to maintaining only a one-version repository (i.e. do this and you get a lucid one, and hey, you can also set multiple if you want)
I don't know what guides you are using, but they are wrong, versions should be seperate, a seperate repo for each ubuntu version

i don't understand how then the standard ubuntu distro has for lucid: "deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ lucid main restricted" and for oneiric: "deb http://us.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ oneiric main restricted"
they are different repos, just one server
look lucid/oneiric, 2 different repos
if you look, they are two seperate repos
they are just hosted on the same server

i'm looking at the source differences from the debian folders between natty and lucid for this deb, and there is nothing but a changelog entry in the launchpad repos i pulled from to build my deb (well, i need a different version of it, and also to distribute it internally to my "friends")
the actual source won't be the same as they are the same versions, but the end package will be different
not sure if you noticed my questions above :)
they don't, they are in TWO REPOS
they are two different packages in 2 different repos

here's the scenario: bzr checkout lp:ubuntu/lucid/poco && cd poco && dpkg-buildpackage, which gives me say libpoco-dev_1.3.6p1-1_amd64.deb built for lucid. next if I bzr checkout lp:ubuntu/natty/poco, i get the exact same deb, this time built for natty (different odbc), i.e. libpoco-dev_1.3.6p1-1_amd64.deb . If i now run reprepro on the lucid one, it works, and next the natty .deb is conflicting with the lucid one. how does ubuntu handle
I'll be with your shortly, just a little busy
ty
i've figured it out: the -0ubuntu1- (or similar cryptic suffixes that avoid name conflicts) are controlled via the changelog
thanks for your help :)
